title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist
description: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature eats too much code. When calling the 'baz' method in the 'bar' method of the provided 'X' class, a parameter needs to be added to make the program correct. The steps to reproduce this issue are as follows: 1. Change the baz call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'. 2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.' 3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist. 4. Type 'f' to filter the list. 5. Select 'foo()' from the list.
EB: The expected behavior is that the code assist will correctly suggest the 'foo()' method and update the code to 'baz(x.x.foo())'. The code assist should only modify the necessary part of the code.
SR:
1. Change the baz call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()' from the list.
